sen.j: 大炊御門家（おおいのみかどけ）は、清華家の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: Oinomikado family was a kuge (court noble) with kakaku (family status) of seigake (the second highest family status for court nobles).
Oinomikado family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of seigake (the second highest family status for court nobles).
Oinomikado family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of seigake (the second highest family status for court nobles).

sen.j: 家業は書道・和歌・笛・装束。
sen.e: Family businesses were shodo (calligraphy), waka (tanka), fue (Japanese flute) and shozoku (costume).
Their family businesses were shodo (calligraphy), waka (tanka), fue (Japanese flute) and shozoku (costume).
Their family businesses were shodo (calligraphy), waka (a 31-syllable Japanese poem), fue (Japanese flute) and shozoku (costume).
Karoku in the Edo Period was 400 koku (approx. 72.2 cubic meters).
Karoku during the Edo Period was 400 koku (approx. 72.2 cubic meters).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) during the Edo Period was 400 koku (approx. 72.2 cubic meters).
Its kamon (family crest) is Hishi ni Katabamiso crest (diamond and cuckooflower).
Its kamon (family crest) is Hishi ni Katabamiso crest (diamond and cuckooflower).
Its kamon (family crest) is Hishi ni Katabamiso crest (diamond and cuckooflower).
Marquis
Marquis
Marquis
It was Fujiwara no Morozane line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
They were within the Fujiwara no Morozane line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
They were within the Fujiwara no Morozane line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 平安時代末期摂政関白藤原師実の子藤原経実（1068年-1131年）を祖として創立された。
sen.e: It was founded in the last days of the Heian Period by FUJIWARA no Tsunezane (1068-1131), who was a son of FUJIWARA no Morosane, Sessho Kanpaku (regent and chief adviser to the Emperor), as the founder.

It was founded during the last days of the Heian Period by FUJIWARA no Tsunezane (1068-1131), who was a son of FUJIWARA no Morosane, Sessho Kanpaku (regent and chief adviser to the Emperor), as the founder.

It was founded during the last days of the Heian Period by FUJIWARA no Tsunezane (1068-1131), who was a son of FUJIWARA no Morozane, Sessho Kanpaku (regent and chief adviser to the Emperor), as the founder.

sen.j: 大炊御門北、万里小路東に邸宅があったため大炊御門を称する。
sen.e: As his mansion was located in Oinomikado-kita (north of Oinomikado) and Madenokoji-higashi (east of Madenokoji), he named himself Oinomikado.
As his mansion was located in Oinomikado-kita (north of Oinomikado) and Madenokoji-higashi (east of Madenokoji), he named himself Oinomikado.
As his mansion was located in Oinomikado-kita (north of Oinomikado) and Madenokoji-higashi (east of Madenokoji), he named himself Oinomikado.

sen.j: 経実は大納言どまりであった。
sen.e: Although Tsunezane's highest rank was dainagon (a chief councillor of state).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外措置
sen.e: Tsunezane's highest rank was dainagon (chief councillor of state).
Tsunezane's highest rank was dainagon (chief councillor of state).

sen.j: しかし、その子藤原経宗（1119年-1189年）は平治の乱で当初藤原信頼・源義朝方に付きながら寝返って平清盛方の勝利に貢献。
sen.e: However, his son, FUJIWARA no Tsunemune (1119-1189), on the occasion of Heiji Disturbance, contributed to the victory of TAIRA no Kiyomori side by first joining FUJIWARA no Nobuyori/MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo side at first and changing side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外措置
sen.e: However, his son, FUJIWARA no Tsunemune (1119-1189), on the occasion of the Heiji Disturbance, contributed to the victory of the TAIRA no Kiyomori side by first joining the FUJIWARA no Nobuyori/MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo side at first and then changing sides.

However, his son, FUJIWARA no Tsunemune (1119-1189), on the occasion of the Heiji War, contributed to the victory of the TAIRA no Kiyomori side by first joining the FUJIWARA no Nobuyori/MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo side at first and then changing sides.

sen.j: また、二条天皇の外舅として勢威をふるい、左大臣に昇って清華家の家格を確保した。
sen.e: Also, he wielded great power as maternal father of the Emperor Nijo and he was promoted to sadaijin (Minister of the left) and secured kakaku of segake.
Also, he wielded great power as the maternal father of Emperor Nijo and he was promoted to sadaijin (Minister of the left) and secured kakaku of segake.
Also, he wielded great power as the maternal father of Emperor Nijo and he was promoted to sadaijin (Minister of the left) and secured kakaku of seigake.

sen.j: 経宗の子藤原頼実（1155年-1225年）は二度に渡って太政大臣を務めている。
sen.e: Tsunemune's son, FUJIWARA no Yorizane (1155-1225) took the position of Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister) twice.
Tsunemune's son, FUJIWARA no Yorizane (1155-1225) took the position of Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister) twice.
Tsunemune's son, FUJIWARA no Yorizane (1155-1225) took the position of Daijo-daijin (Grand Minister) twice.

sen.j: 明治維新後、大炊御門幾麿（いくまろ）の代に侯爵を授けられた。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, the position of marquis was conferred on this family in the generation of Ikumaro OINOMIKADO.
After the Meiji Restoration, the position of marquis was conferred on this family during the generation of Ikumaro OINOMIKADO.
After the Meiji Restoration, the position of marquis was conferred on this family during the generation of Ikumaro OINOMIKADO.
